content: I made a tiny RP (#18979) a few weeks ago. One user approved the changes but didn't bors d+ me. Is there something I have to do on my end or was the PR just overlooked?

That's because the user in question doesn't have the power to merge :)

The reason you're stuck is that most of the maintainers' efforts are going towards the port to lean 4 right now, but asking here is the right next step

Unfortunately the file you're changing was ported in !4#4140 last week.

Is this something you need for a larger project or just something you happened to notice was missing?

oh I see, so this file now requires an equivalent PR for mathlib4, I can do that later

It's a theorem I found out about recently and noticed it wasn't in mathlib

So there's two options here: either we get the mathlib 3 pr reviewed and landed, and then afterwards we use the automatically generated lean 4 code from mathport to make a corresponding mathlib 4 pr. (You could make this second pr, but you wouldn't have to.)

Alternatively, you can abandon the mathlib 3 pr and make a new mathlib 4 pr either by translating manually or using mathport's "one shot" feature.

What we'd generally prefer you not to do is land the same lemmas in both mathlib 3 and 4 when they're translated manually.
I've left a review; feel free to ping me if I don't respond to your responses
This looks pretty easy to forward-port so doing in mathlib3 seems harmless if that's what you want to do
